relation: Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
we are located right along the river.
i think uwec is a very good school for the money, less than madison and just as good.
there are a lot of activities right on campus, plenty of free activities.
i lived in the dorm the first semester. it was not for me as i like quiet and privacy.
if you study instead of party, you will do just fine.
get involved sign up early for classes and dorms
the school is great, medium size. teachers are approachable. lots to offer.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {316369=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 78460=Eau Claire has a great academic program with lots of choices of classes. The campus is located right on the Chippewa River and has lots of trails to hike and activities to do outside. There is a brand new student center being built and will be done for the Fall 2012 semester, it looks awesome!}

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck College is never cheap, but costs are very reasonable (compare to UW-Madison) for the quality of education and the college experience you will receive. Lots of financial aid is available if you take the time to apply for it. Am enjoying being here Campus is BEAUTIFUL, especially in fall and spring. Freshmen have a great view of the Chippewa River from the dorms! Weekends are very eventful and parties are plentiful. Great place for active people... lots of hiking/biking trails, workout facilities, floating down the river, etc... Am learning a lot For a smaller university, UWEC offers a really wide range of classes. You can study anatomy, geology, and modern dance all in one day if you want. Professors are very passionate and really go out of their way to make sure students understand material. You will write a lot of papers (EC is known for it) but the practice and feedback is very beneficial. Nursing program is extremely competitive... beware if you're considering that as your major. Login to rate or flag the reviews John from Glenwood City, WI
